Articles.Content:
After rapidly and unexpectedly disassembling several kilotons of kerosene, oxium, solid rocket fuel, and countless astonishingly toxic hypergolic rocket propellants to little effect, the 'leaders' of the space race chose to pool their resources. Perhaps together they could strut together something that could punch through the as-yet theorized Kerman Line and maybe even fall fast enough to miss the ground and hit another celestial body. Perhaps... To that end, they founded IKEA, the International Kerbin Exploration Agency, a multinational public/private partnership between the five states of the USK, the anti-socialist republics of the UASR, and the OU, (as well as number of smaller, vastly less important countries) and several private companies including one J. Kerman's junkyard and discount rocket parts.

This is their story.

*****

Sprout 1a:

Despite a some pretty impressive construction (and a swimming pool and conference center that screamed 'money laundering'), the KSC was practically a ghost town. After all, the number of Kerbals Brave or Stupid enough to entertain the notion of launching things into space was not especially long. But by Zod (kneel before him...), everyone here was committed.

"I vould like to bring zis first meeting to order," said the famous Wernher von Kerman, wearing truly vile floral swim trunks. One hand held a whiteboard marker, the other, a fruity drink with an umbrella. "Our finance man...vat vas hees name again..."

Mortimer Kerman, the only one wearing a suit in the sweltering tropical heat of Uoruok (but even he couldn't say no to a pina colada), coughed irately. "Mortimer."

"Ah, ja," said Wernher. "...Mortimer has ensured that ve haf a blank check as long as ve do not ask to many inconvenient questions about where ze money is coming from. Is zis correckt?"

"It's better that you don't know," said Mortimer, leering ominously over a hot pink paper umbrella.

"In any event, as you haf read in your briefings," (a number of kerbals looked around nervously). Wernher cocked a fuzzy grey eyebrow: "You haf read ze breifings, ja?"

"Pardon?" asked Robert "Bob" Kerman, coughing out his R's with an insufferable Wrench accent "I 'ave not seen zee briefing."

"Never got 'em," agreed William "Bill" Kerman in an Extas drawl.

"Sorry, Komrade,"

"Is that what those were?" asked Jedediah Kerman in the most infuriatingly average Oh-Hian accent imaginable from the deep end of the pool. "Put 'em in my pocket."

"Very vell," sighed Wernher. "We did not need ze briefings anyway. Our primary objekif is to determine exactly how dificult it ist to reach this 'space...'

Javascript is disabled. View full album

(Tune in next episode as IKEA continues to attempt to put things into space. In fact, that's pretty much all they do...)
